Overview.Title: Movie Quote Memorability Qualification Test
Overview.FormattedContent:
• You will be given pairs of quotes and asked to identify whether one, both or neither quote is memorable.
  • A quote is defined as memorable if you recognize it from the movie which it came from.
  • You will need to correctly identify as many memorable quotes as you can in order to qualify.
  • If you are unsure, make your best guess. It is NOT important that you identify ALL of them correctly.

Example 1

For these quotes from "The Wizard of Oz", only the first quote should be identified as memorable.
  • "Toto, I've got a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore."
  • "I know, but we all got to work out our own problems."

Example 2

For these quotes from "The Wizard of Oz", only the second quote should be identified as memorable.
  • "Oh, goodness! How did you ever get like this?"
  • "Follow the Yellow Brick Road."

Example 3

For these quotes from "The Wizard of Oz", both quotes should be identified as memorable.
  • "Toto, I've got a feeling we're not in Kansas anymore."
  • "Follow the Yellow Brick Road."

Example 4

For these quotes from "The Wizard of Oz", neither quote should be identified as memorable.
  • "It's all right. You can all get up."
  • "Now which way do we go?"
